description:
net/http: Add a URL field to http.Response, which
contains the effective URL after any redirects have
been followed.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

It's too late to make API changes before Go 1.1. Please remind us of
this CL in a couple of months.

On 2013/04/05 09:58:22, dsymonds wrote:
> It's too late to make API changes before Go 1.1. Please remind us of
> this CL in a couple of months.

Hi David,

I now know that 1.1. is in feature freeze, but it was under the impression that submitting CLs with changes was still OK, even when they won't be looked at for weeks. Isn't that the case?

Regards,
Alberto

On Fri, Apr 5, 2013 at 9:41 AM,  <alberto.garcia.hierro@gmail.com> wrote:
> On 2013/04/05 09:58:22, dsymonds wrote:
>>
>> It's too late to make API changes before Go 1.1. Please remind us of
>> this CL in a couple of months.
>
>
> Hi David,
>
> I now know that 1.1. is in feature freeze, but it was under the
> impression that submitting CLs with changes was still OK, even when they
> won't be looked at for weeks. Isn't that the case?

Yes, and that is what David meant: remind us of this in a couple of
months, and we will look at it then.  Thanks.

Ian

subject: code review 8312044: net/http: Add a URL field to http.Response, which
